page.title: 03West Ashey Farm 2
page.content: At West Ashey Farm there are 2 Hereford bulls.The cows are{Limousin, {Charollais, and Friesians.} In one of the sheds there are 30 cows and a calf which was not even a day old. After 4 days, the calf will leave its mother and be weaned onto a machine that was only built today. The machine is like an artificial mother; it has 3 teats which the calves suck to get milk. The farmers keep the cows for{milk, {beef and breeding.}When the cows are sold they weigh around 10 hundred weight(about 500kg).The farmers have to keep two different types of grazing land.This is because the cows like long grass and the sheep like short grass. At the farm there are two injured {racehorses}, called Pitlochry & John Willoughby (both are 16.2 hands high).
